abstract: Washington Mutual, the giant lender that came to symbolize the excesses of the mortgage boom, was seized by federal regulators on Thursday night, in what is by far the largest bank failure in American history, The New York Times’s Eric Dash and Andrew Ross Sorkin reported.
lead_paragraph: Washington Mutual, the giant lender that came to symbolize the excesses of the mortgage boom, was seized by federal regulators on Thursday night, in what is by far the largest bank failure in American history, The New York Times’s Eric Dash and Andrew Ross Sorkin reported.

headline.main: WaMu Fails, and JPMorgan Steps In
